name: Easy SEO Toolkit
author: Stanley van Heusden

sections.description:
WordPress SEO plugin for modern websites
Easy SEO Toolkit is a WordPress SEO plugin that integrates seamlessly with Gutenberg, Classic Editor and the Elementor Pagebuilder.

The plugin enables the possibility to add keywords, meta titles and descriptions. Next to that it generates an XML Sitemap for your site.

Elementor SEO plugin
Stop switching back from your Elementor pages to the dashboard to configure your SEO settings. This plugins adds the functionality to Elementor to:

  • Add Keywords
  • Add Meta Titles
  • Add Meta Descriptions
  • Add Twitter Cards automaticly
  • Add XML Sitemap to your site!

All from the “Page Settings” section.

Coming Soon to Easy SEO Toolkit
We are currently working on some big new features that will improve our plugin.

  • Keyword Density checker
  • Sitemap Configurator
  • General Settings panel

If you want to stay up-to-date about these updates, please subscribe to our newsletter at EasySEOToolkit.com or follow us on Twitter.
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/plugin-name directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress
  3. Use the Settings->Plugin Name screen to configure the plugin
  4. (Make your instructions match the desired user flow for activating and installing your plugin. Include any steps that might be needed for explanatory purposes)
sections.faq:
Is this plugin compatible with Gutenberg?

Easy SEO Toolkit is 100% compatible with the Gutenberg Editor.

Is this plugin compatible with the Classic Editor?

Easy SEO Toolkit is 100% compatible with the Classic Editor.

Is this plugin compatible with Elementor?

Easy SEO Toolkit is 100% compatible with the Elementor Page Builder and works from the Page Settings on your Elementor pages.
sections.changelog:
0.7.0

We’re back! After a long break, I started focussing on the development of Easy SEO Toolkit again. Expect more updates to follow in the coming weeks with added and improved functionality.

In this update:
* Updated compatibility with the latest version of WordPress, Elementor & Elementor Pro.
* Bug fix: SEO Tab wasn’t visible in Elementor editor.

0.6.0

  • New: Added Twitter Cards meta tags!

0.5.5

  • Bug fix: Archive title displayed first single result’s title.

0.5.4

Small tweaks in file loading and background checks.

0.5.3

  • Bug fix: Elementor Pro users had a conflict with our JavaScript. This is solved now.

0.5.2

  • Added a control to kd-elementor-editor.js that checks if the settings are displayed.

0.5.1

  • Bug fix: Defined an undefined PHP variable.

0.5.0

  • New function: XML Sitemap generator!
  • Changed the prefix of the meta_fields.
  • You can now use Easy SEO Toolkit with Gutenberg and the Classic Editor!

0.0.3

  • Added a filter to set the title tag to the SEO title.
  • Added screenshots
  • Changed the prefix of the meta_fields.

0.0.1

  • Initial release!

short_description: Add keywords, Meta Titles and Meta Descriptions right from the WordPress editor or Elementor Page Settings panel with Easy SEO Toolkit.
